name: High Elves
background:
High Elves are a faction of prosperous Elven principalities made up of traders and merchant-princes. Their wealth allows them to maintain elite and highly mobile armies, emphasising cavalry and archery over more durable line infantry. 

The High Elves have built a prosperous realm along the coast of Tyria, though they remain a shadow of their former glory. The High Elves once sought to build an empire to rival humanity and unite the Elves under their rule. Instead, their ambitions have twice resulted in costly and violent civil war, which has left the Elven peoples fragmented.
backgroundFull:
The Elves of Tyria once lived together in the Heartwoods, which took up much of western Tyria. These Elves often came into conflict with Humans encroaching on their borders. Over time, some Elves began to learn from their foes, taking metal weapons and tools from them, and they even began trading with them. These Elves started to adapt human tools and knowledge to their home. They called themselves High Elves, as they began to build stone towers and claim parts of the forest lands for their Kingdoms, driving out those who refused to adopt their ways. The remaining Elves allied with the spirits of the forest and fought back, defeating the High Elves and forcing them into exile. 

The High Elves migrated to the coast of Tyria, on the edge of the Heartwood forest. They settled this isolated and sparsely populated land, and rapidly built new cities of stone and steel along the coast, while using whatever lumber they could find to build great fleets. These cities competed for power and position amongst themselves, and High Elven rulers considered wealth, intrigue, and knowledge to be every bit as critical to their citiesâ€™ welfare as castle walls and a standing army. 

The High Elves sought out knowledge and skills, like smithing and craftsmanship from their neighbours, while jealously guarding their own secrets. Enterprising High Elves became wealthy and powerful, while the rest risked falling into poverty. They built trade colonies throughout Tyria, but their richest colonies were in the Dark Isles, where the High Elves grew spices and mined gold.

When the Havoc Gods arrived in Tyria, the High Elves reluctantly set aside their old rivalry with the Wood Elves to make a temporary alliance, offering their aid in exchange for wood and other supplies to build their fleets and feed their armies. This alliance soon expanded to include much of Tyria, with Dwarves, Humans and Goblins. However, the Elves of the Dark Isles took the chance to declare their independence. When their conflict with the Havoc Gods ended, the remaining High Elven armies and fleets sought to reclaim their lost colonies, but were soundly defeated by the Dark Elves and their allies. 

Now the High Elves have lost their fleet and colonies, whilst Havoc followers raid their shores, and the Wood Elves refuse to aid them. Still, the High Elves seek out new opportunities, exploring through Voidgates and forging new alliances. 

How will you return your people to prosperity?

spells.name: Eagle-Eyed Focus
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value:
var range = params.effect.attackType?.value ?? 24;
return (this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 }))

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Arcane Blast
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 1 hit with Blast(3).

parameters.name: effectDuration

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Magic Arrows
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with AP(1) and Crack each. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Spell Conduit
specialRules.description: Casters within 12" that are from other friendly units may cast spells as if they were in this model's position, and get +1 to casting rolls when doing so.

specialRules.name: Piercing Tag
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. When attacking, friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to block to get +AP(Y), where Y is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Highborn
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Relentless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Relentless. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Fearless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fearless. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Indirect when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Indirect when shooting.

specialRules.name: Precision Shooting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Shielded Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Shielded. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Crack
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Highborn Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Highborn Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Shred in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Shred in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spellâ€™s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18â€ in line of sight of the casterâ€™s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Fearless
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule fails a morale test, roll one die. On a 4+ it counts as passed instead.

specialRules.name: Fear
specialRules.description: This model counts as having dealt +X wounds when checking wound effects in melee (must deal at least one wound).

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Highborn Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Highborn, it moves +4" on Advance and +4" on Rush/Charge from Highborn (instead of only +2" and +2").

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3â€ of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3â€ of any model from the target (defender picks how).
